comments.body: @johnnyreilly why you provide type names here? If definition already have type information for parameters it should just work.

@igorbek I think i specified them as a way of testing that the correct types were being passed through to showErrors. Alternatively I could put code in the method that depended on those specific types but I thought this was more specific.

Totally agree that type + usage tests are far better than type alone. I have some code that works on ErrorDictionary and ErrorListItem which I hope to add into the test at some point so usage is tested (as it isn't now)
By the way, thanks for voting up the CodePlex issue related to the TS 0.9.5 bug with Declaration Merging (in a project context). I really appreciate it.
